newsitem.title: USA: IBM stock halted, Q2 EPS above views.
newsitem.headline: IBM stock halted, Q2 EPS above views.

text.p: After-hours trading in shares of International Business Machines Corp was halted on Monday as the company released second-quarter earnings of $1.46 per share, $0.04 above analysts' expectations.
IBM stock vacillated during the regular trading session ahead of the earnings release, with traders attributing some of the investor concern to Microsoft Corp earnings released last week.
Microsoft posted fourth-quarter earnings per share just a penny above expectations on Thursday. Its share price has since dropped more than 13 points.
IBM's earnings were expected to land close to analysts' estimates or even to hover slightly above them.
According to First Call, analysts' consensus foresaw earnings of $1.42 for IBM, with a range from $1.36 to $1.50.
